repnme.cdata!:
Sudan - Second Phase of the Southern Sudan
            Umbrella Program for Health System Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Phase of the
            Southern Sudan Umbrella Program for Health System
            Development Project for were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the Grantee
            performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            central distribution of pharmaceuticals in post conflict
            situations is as difficult as it is challenging. In South
            Sudan, given the poor infrastructure, poor road network and
            difficult geographical terrain, contracting out improved
            commodity availability in facilities helped create
            confidence in the population to seek services at facilities.
            Development of Health systems may not be the preferred
            approach for international aid agencies and Non-
            Governmental Organizations NGOs) working in a post conflict
            situation as results of such investments are mostly long
            term and not immediate. Hence, a project approach may be the
            preferred approach to show results. This requires a careful
            balance between strengthening the system and continuously
            improving the system over time. In post conflict situations,
            challenges in human resources availability, skill set mix as
            well as challenges associated with implementation with
            scarce human resource capacity are inevitable; the use of
            partners to support government to deliver service may not
            support government develop its systems unless the Government
            provides strong leadership.

repnme.cdata!:
Sudan - Southern Sudan Umbrella Program for
            Health System Development Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objectives of the
            Southern Sudan Umbrella Program for Health System
            Development Project is to improve the delivery of the Basic
            Package of Health Services (BPHS) in four states (Upper
            Nile, Jongeli, Central Equatoria, and Eastern Equatoria);
            strengthen the key stewardship functions of the Ministry of
            Health (MOH), including monitoring. The closing date of the
            project will be extended from June 30, 2012 until September
            28, 2012. The extension will give enough time for the
            successful completion of ongoing activities and a successful
            achievement of the development objective. The MOH, which is
            the implementing entity, has submitted through MOFEP the
            formal request for extension of the project up to September
            28, 2012. The MOH has also submitted the revised plan of
            action which shows that the planned activities under the
            project will be completed by September 28, 2012. This will
            be the second extension of the project for a total of three months.

            Program for Health System Development Project :
